description: UMD 4.3.0 is a regular update of the fourth Major release of UMD. It contains new products for CentOS7 and updates both for SL6 and CentOS7.
releaseNotes: This release contains the following products: <br><br>*** CentOS7 ***<br><br>* Job Scheduling, Job Execution<br>ARC 15.03.9<br><br>* Client Tools<br>gfal2 2.11.1<br>gfal2-utils 1.3.2<br>gfal2-python 1.8.4<br><br>* Data Access<br>XROOT 4.4.0<br>Davix 0.6.3<br><br>* File access, File transfer<br>dCache 2.16.14<br><br>* Authorization<br>ARGUS server 1.7<br><br>* Credential management<br>Gridsite 2.3.3<br><br>* Other<br>edg-mkgrid 4.0.4<br>umd-release 4.1.2<br><br>*** SL6 ***<br><br>* Job Scheduling, Job Execution<br>ARC 15.03.9<br><br>* Job execution<br>GRAM5 13.13.0<br><br>* Client Tools<br>gfal2 2.11.1<br>gfal2-utils 1.3.2<br><br>* Data Access<br>XROOT 4.4.0<br><br>* File access, File transfer, Storage management<br>dCache 2.16.14<br>DPM 1.8.11<br><br>* File transfer<br>Globus GridFTP 10.4.1<br><br>* Authentication<br>globus-default-security 6.3.0<br><br>* Authorization<br>lcas-lcmaps-gt4 0.3.1<br>lcmaps 1.6.6<br>lcmaps-plugins 1.7.1<br>glexec-wn 1.3.0<br><br>* Credential management<br>Gridsite 2.3.3<br>MyProxy 6.1.18<br><br>* Attribute Authority<br>VOMS Admin 3.5.0/VOMS Server 2.0.14/VOMS Clients 3.0.7<br><br>* other<br>edg-mkgrid 4.0.4<br>umd-release 4.1.2<br>YAIM core 5.1.3
installationNotes: All products in UMD 4.3.0 were verified against EGI's current Quality Criteria. Installation and configuration notes are available in the EGI repository.
contact: For further information about the UMD, its goals and surrounding processes, and more information about how to engage as a Technology Provider with EGI, please send an Email to: cto (at) egi.eu.
technicalContact: For any bugs and issues you encounter that are not described in the release notes of this UMD release, or the related documentation provided by the Technology Providers, please visit the EGI Helpdesk (https://ggus.eu/) to make a report.
knownIssues: Please visit https://wiki.egi.eu/wiki/UMD-4:UMD-4.3.0 for known issues.
changeLog: This release contains the following products:<br><ul><li>ARC, GFAL2, XROOT, Davix, dCache, ARGUS, Gridsite, edg-mkgrid, umd-release for CentOS7</li><li>ARC, GFAL2, XROOT, Gridsite, edg-mkgrid, umd-release, DPM, GRAM5, Globus GridFTP, globus-default-security, MyProxy, Davix, dCache, VOMS Admin, VOMS, VOMS Clients, YAIM core, lcmaps, lcmaps-plugins, lcas-lcmaps-gt4 for SL6</li></ul>

products.name: arc.arc
products.description: The Advanced Resource Connector (ARC) middleware is an Open Source software solution to enable distributed computing infrastructures with the emphasis on processing large volumes of data. ARC provides an abstraction layer over computational resources, complete with input and output data movement functionalities. The security model of ARC is identical to that of Grid solutions, relying on delegation of user credentials and the concept of Virtual Organisations. ARC also provides client tools, as well as API in C++, Python and Java

products.name: cern.davix
products.description: davix is a C++ toolkit for advanced I/O on remote resources with HTTP based protocols.

products.name: cern.edg-mkgrid
products.description: http://www.eu-emi.eu/releases/emi-3-monte-bianco/updates/-/asset_publisher/5Na8/content/update-23-16-12-2014-v-3-14-0-1#edg_mkgridmap_v_4_0_1

products.name: cern.gfal2-python
products.description: https://svnweb.cern.ch/trac/lcgutil/wiki/gfal2

products.name: cern.gfal2-utils
products.description: https://svnweb.cern.ch/trac/lcgutil/wiki/gfal2

products.name: cern.yaim-core
products.description: https://twiki.cern.ch/twiki/bin/view/EGEE/YAIM
products.releaseNotes: this update handles the fact that with VOMS clients v. 3.0.7 the RFC proxies are the default proxy type.

products.name: cesnet.gridsite
products.description: https://github.com/CESNET/gridsite
products.changeLog: This is a bugfix release addressing erroneous counter incrementation with Robot proxy certificates.

products.name: cnaf.voms-admin-server
products.description: The Virtual Organization Membership Service (VOMS) is an attribute authority which serves as central repository for VO user authorization information, providing support for sorting users into group hierarchies, keeping track of their roles and other attributes in order to issue trusted attribute certificates and SAML assertions used in the Grid environment for authorization purposes.

products.name: dcache.dcache
products.description: dCache provides system for storing and retrieving huge amounts of data, distributed among a large number of heterogenous server nodes, under a single virtual filesystem tree with a variety of standard access methods.

products.name: dpm.dpm-dsi
products.description:
The Disk Pool Manager (DPM) is a lightweight storage solution for grid sites. It offers a
simple way to create a disk-based grid storage element and supports relevant protocols
(SRM, gridFTP, RFIO) for file management and access. It focus on manageability (ease
of installation, configuration, low effort of maintenance), while providing all required
functionality for a grid storage solution (support for multiple disk server nodes,
different space types, multiple file replicas in disk pools).

products.name: dpm.dpm
products.description:
The Disk Pool Manager (DPM) is a lightweight storage solution for grid sites. It offers a
simple way to create a disk-based grid storage element and supports relevant protocols
(SRM, gridFTP, RFIO) for file management and access. It focus on manageability (ease
of installation, configuration, low effort of maintenance), while providing all required
functionality for a grid storage solution (support for multiple disk server nodes,
different space types, multiple file replicas in disk pools).

products.name: epel.xroot
products.description: http://xrootd.org/docs.html

products.name: gfal2.gfal2
products.description: GFAL (Grid File Access Library ) is a C library providing an abstraction layer of the grid storage system complexity.

products.name: glexec-wn.glexec-wn
products.description: gLExec is a program that acts as a light-weight (gatekeeper). gLExec takes Grid credentials as input. gLExec takes the local site policy into account to authenticate and authorize the credentials. gLExec will switch to a new execution sandbox and execute the given command as the switched identity. gLExec is also capable of functioning as a light-weight control point which offers a binary yes/no result called the logging-only mode.
products.releaseNotes: Adding extra dependency to the new vo-ca-ap plugin
products.changeLog: Adding extra dependency to the new vo-ca-ap plugin

products.name: globus.globus-default-security
products.description: These components establish the identity of users or services (authentication), protect communications, and determine who is allowed to perform what actions (authorization), as well as manage user credentials.

products.name: globus.gram5
products.description: The Grid Resource Allocation and Management (GRAM5) interface as a basic mechanism for initiation, monitoring, management, scheduling, and/or coordination of remote computations.

products.name: globus.gridftp
products.description: GridFTP provides high-performance and reliable data transport.

products.name: globus.myproxy
products.description: MyProxy is open source software for managing X.509 Public Key Infrastructure (PKI) security credentials (certificates and private keys). MyProxy combines an online credential repository with an online certificate authority to allow users to securely obtain credentials when and where needed. Users run myproxy logon to authenticate and obtain credentials, including trusted CA certificates and Certificate Revocation Lists (CRLs).

products.name: infn.argus
products.description: http://argus-documentation.readthedocs.io/en/latest/release_notes.html#v1-7-0
products.changeLog: This release provides a fix for the following issue: https://github.com/argus-authz/argus-pap/issues, that caused SSL authentication errors for the pap-admin client after the upgrade to the latest JRE.

products.name: lcas-lcmaps-gt4.lcas-lcmaps-gt4
products.description: gLExec is a program that acts as a light-weight (gatekeeper). gLExec takes Grid credentials as input. gLExec takes the local site policy into account to authenticate and authorize the credentials. gLExec will switch to a new execution sandbox and execute the given command as the switched identity. gLExec is also capable of functioning as a light-weight control point which offers a binary yes/no result called the logging-only mode.
products.releaseNotes:
lcas-lcmaps-gt4-interface 0.3.0-0.3.1
- Implement support for the globus 'sharing' service.
- Properly handle a 'desired_identity' coming from the Globus framework (e.g.
gsissh).
- Minor cleanup and bug fixes

products.name: lcmaps-plugins.lcmaps-plugins
products.description: It provides the functionality for making authorization decisions based on the combination of (type of) CA and VO. This is needed for supporting the IGTF IOTA profile of CAs: due to the lower Level-of-Assurance (LoA), those CAs are only allowed in combination with higher LoA VOs. We are also busy with creating a plugin (a PIP) for the Argus framework for providing the same functionality there, but that is not ready yet.
products.releaseNotes:
lcmaps-plugins-basic 1.6.2-1.7.1  
- Move to new lcmaps-gridmapfile and lcmaps-gridmapdir functions,
syncing code with the lcmaps-plugins-robot code-base. These new
functions are a major rework of the original ancient and buggy
lcmaps-gridlist codebase. Among other things it fixes a number of
grid-mapfile parsing problems and problems when using a default
grid-mapfile.
- Extensive cleanup and synchronization of different banning and mapping
plugins ban_dn, localaccount and poolaccount.

lcmaps-plugins-robot 0.0.1-0.0.5 - new component needed *only* for infrastructure supporting the LToS.
See http://wiki.nikhef.nl/grid/Lcmaps-plugins-robot

lcmaps-plugins-verify-proxy 1.5.7-1.5.9
- add commandline tool verify-proxy-tool.
- add some logging and warnings on key-length and signing algorithm problems.
- numerous small improvements and bugfixes.

lcmaps-plugins-vo-ca-ap 0.0.2 
- install default vo-ca-ap-file

lcmaps-plugins-voms 1.7.0-1.7.1 (see also lcmaps-plugins-basic)
- Move to new lcmaps-gridmapfile and lcmaps-gridmapdir functions,
syncing code with the lcmaps-plugins-robot and lcmaps-plugins-basic
code-base. These new functions are a extensive rework of the original
ancient and buggy lcmaps-gridlist codebase. Among other things it
fixes a number of grid-mapfile parsing problems and problems when
using a default grid-mapfile.
- Extensive cleanup and synchronization of different banning and mapping
plugins ban_fqan, voms_localaccount and voms_poolaccount.
- Synchronize and improve GID mapping options between voms_localaccount
and voms_poolaccount plugins. Several of these flags were either
inconsistent or missing.

products.name: lcmaps.lcmaps
products.description: It provides the functionality for making authorization decisions based on the combination of (type of) CA and VO. This is needed for supporting the IGTF IOTA profile of CAs: due to the lower Level-of-Assurance (LoA), those CAs are only allowed in combination with higher LoA VOs. We are also busy with creating a plugin (a PIP) for the Argus framework for providing the same functionality there, but that is not ready yet.

products.name: umd.umd-release
products.description: umd repository configuration that adds all missing repositories that are needed for the installation of UMD products and configures yum priorities
